current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To improve the provision of health care by the Department of Veterans Affairs to veterans in rural
			 and highly rural areas, and for other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

text.#text: The
An eligible veteran described in this subsection is a veteran that—

has a mental health issue resulting from post-traumatic stress disorder, traumatic brain injury, or
			 any other health condition that was incurred or aggravated in line of duty
			 in the active military, naval, or air service; and
lives in a rural area or highly rural area.

text.#text: The term

header.#text:
Pilot program on housing allowances for health care providers of the Department of Veterans Affairs
			 accepting assignment at rural and highly rural community-based outpatient
			 clinics

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may carry out a pilot program to assess the feasibility and
			 advisability of providing a housing allowance to health care providers of
			 the

who accept assignment  at rural or
			 highly rural community-based outpatient clinics as a means of encouraging
			 such health care providers to accept assignment to such clinics.

text.#text: The
An individual is eligible for participation in the pilot program if the individual—
is a health care provider;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
on a full-time basis in
			 a health care position designated by the

for purposes of the
			 pilot program; and

text.#text: is, or agrees to become, an employee of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
for
			 purposes of the pilot program.

text.#text:
accepts an assignment in such position for a term of not less than 36 months at a rural or highly
			 rural community-based outpatient clinic selected by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, an individual may be provided a housing allowance under
			 the pilot program only while—

text.#text: Except as provided in

header.#text: Conditions on payment of housing allowance

text.#text: in good standing as a health care provider within the Veterans Health Administration; and
assigned as a health care provider at a rural or highly rural community-based outpatient clinic.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, to members of the uniformed services whose grade,
			 dependency status, and geographic location most closely equals, as
			 determined by the
, the grade of such provider under

, United States Code, and the dependency status and geographic
			 location of such provider.

text.#text:
During the first 36 months of participation in the pilot program, the housing allowance provided a
			 health care provider participating in the pilot program shall	be provided
			 on a monthly basis at a rate that is equivalent to the monthly rate of
			 basic allowance for housing (BAH) payable under

If upon completion of the first 36 months in the pilot program a health care provider accepts
			 continuing participation in the pilot program at a rural or highly rural
			 community-based outpatient clinic for a term of not less than 12
			 additional months, the housing allowance provided the health care provider
			 under the pilot program shall be provided on a monthly basis for such
			 additional months at a rate determined in accordance with

header.#text: Monthly amount for certain providers for additional term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
during the last
			 month before the provider's completion of participation in the pilot
			 program.

text.#text:
Any health care provider who successfully completes 36 months of participation in the pilot program
			 shall be paid upon completion of participation in the pilot program an
			 amount equal to three months of the monthly rate of housing allowance
			 provided the health care provider under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
during the last
			 month before the provider's completion of participation in the pilot
			 program.

text.#text:
Any health care provider who successfully completes 48 months of participation in the pilot program
			 shall be paid upon completion of participation in the pilot program an
			 amount equal to 12 months of the monthly rate of housing allowance
			 provided the health care provider under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
during the last
			 month before the provider's completion of participation in the pilot
			 program.

text.#text:
Any health care provider who successfully completes 60 months of participation in the pilot program
			 shall be paid upon completion of participation in the pilot program an
			 amount equal to 13 months of the monthly rate of housing allowance
			 provided the health care provider under

An amount payable under this paragraph shall be paid whether or not the health care provider
			 concerned remains in an assignment at a rural or highly rural
			 community-based outpatient clinic.

text.#text:
Any housing allowance provided under the pilot program shall be in addition to any pay (including
			 basic pay, special pay, and retirement or other bonus pay) payable to
			 personnel of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, any housing allowance provided under the pilot
			 program shall not be included in gross income.

			 once each year thereafter while the pilot program is in effect, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall include the following:

text.#text: Each report submitted under

A current description of the pilot program, including the current number of participants in the
			 pilot program and the amounts of housing allowance being provided such
			 participants.

A current assessment of the value of the housing allowance under the pilot program in encouraging
			 health care providers in accepting assignment to rural and highly rural
			 community-based outpatient clinics.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: for Medical Services.

text.#text:
Amounts for housing allowances under the pilot program shall be derived from amounts available for
			 the

No individual may commence participation in the pilot program on or after the date that is five
			 years after the date of the enactment of this Act.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall be construed to prohibit the Secretary from providing housing
			 allowances under the pilot program to individuals who commence
			 participation in the pilot program before the date that is five years
			 after the date of the enactment of this Act.

header.#text: Rural or highly rural community-Based outpatient clinic defined

Program on training health care professionals for assignment at community-based outpatient clinics
			 that predominantly serve veterans who live in rural and highly rural areas

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall establish a program to train health care professionals for
			 assignment at community-based outpatient clinics that predominantly serve
			 veterans who live in rural and highly rural areas.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may enter into partnerships with educational
			 institutions.

text.#text: In carrying out the program, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
enters into a partnership with an educational institution  to carry out the
			 program, the

shall consult with the head of such educational
			 institution with respect to the training and curriculum provided under the
			 program at such educational institution.

text.#text: If the

The training provided to health care professionals under the program shall include the following
			 courses:
Courses on general professional development of health care professionals.
Courses on providing health care to rural populations and specifically to rural veterans.

The program shall include training with respect to health issues that commonly afflict veterans as
			 specified by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
at the end
			 of such three-year assignment.

text.#text:
Each health care professional that completes the program and completes a three-year assignment at a
			 community-based outpatient clinic that predominantly serves veterans who
			 live in rural and highly rural areas shall receive a preference in
			 selection for employment in the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall be less than the preference given a veteran.

shall receive a greater preference than an
			 individual that receives a preference under such paragraph who is not a
			 veteran.

Encouraging and facilitating transition of military medical professionals into employment with

header.#text: Facilitation of transition to employment with Veterans Health Administration
Assessment of community-based outpatient clinics in rural and highly rural areas

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall conduct a periodic  assessment of  community-based
			 outpatient clinics in rural and highly rural areas to determine whether 
			 expansion and improvement of community-based outpatient clinics in those
			 areas is feasible or advisable.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall include the following with respect to
			 each community-based outpatient clinic assessed:

text.#text: Each periodic assessment required by
An assessment of whether the facility—
meets applicable building code requirements;
meets  applicable health care requirements related to privacy;
has the capacity to handle the number of patients that seek care at the facility;
has sufficient parking for patients that seek care at the facility;

has adequate access to broadband technology to allow the use or expansion of telehealth services at
			 the facility; and
has the capacity to properly store and dispose of medical and other hazardous waste.
A survey of health care providers who practice at the facility with respect to—
strengths of the facility;
weaknesses of the facility; and
areas in which the facility may be improved.

Committee on Appropriations of

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: with respect to the most recently completed assessment conducted under
, including such recommendations as the

may have
			 for the expansion or improvement of community-based outpatient clinics in
			 rural and highly rural areas.

to veterans who served in the active military, naval, or air service on or after September 11,
